ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: You learn about the theories of Marx, Weber, Durkheim, as well as anthropological writings that draw on them.I would recommend Anthropology 501 for those who are not taking it as a core course but would like a firm grounding in classical social theory, because though challenging, this course accomplishes just that.
This course is a thorough overview of seminal texts in social classical theory. There is quite a bit reading and the course is not tough, but rewarding.
I would recommend it for a thorough reading of primary sources.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It leads me think about how classical social theory applies to the anthropology as a discipline, as well as my own research interests.
